summary: This is a news article from Law360 dated October 14, 2020, reporting that a Second Circuit panel offered measured support for Ghislaine Maxwell's challenge to an order calling for the release of a deposition central to her case. The article frames this within the context of Maxwell being charged with helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Defendant, former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein charged with helping him abuse underage girls; she is challenging an order to release a deposition central to her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whom Ghislaine Maxwell is accused of helping to abuse underage girls.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as the former girlfriend of Epstein and is charged with helping him abuse underage girls.

events.title: Second Circuit Panel Hears Maxwell's Sealing Bid
events.description: A Second Circuit panel offered measured support for Ghislaine Maxwell's challenge to an order calling for the release of a deposition central to her case.

keyFacts: A Second Circuit panel offered measured support for Ghislaine Maxwell's bid to seal a deposition.
Maxwell is charged with helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.
The deposition in question is described as being 'at the heart of her case'.
The news article is dated October 14, 2020.
The document references a series of related file identifiers (EFTA00084846 through EFTA00084851).
